storyInfo: Reed and Selmon have a disagreement over which way the group should go. Selmon has been distinct from the fleeing refugees the whole time; she wants to rescue more Tarans, just as Dublinn has.

attributes.content: History records that out of a sense the war between the Draco and Aslan had become far too protracted and bitter, the final King Gaeil signed a peace treaty.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: Legends say he opted to melt down his soldiers' weapons as a sign of his determination, but his subjects could hardly accept such a defeat. Thus they conspired to revolt, and assassinated the monarch.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: But just as you've referenced in many a speech, a single assassination is not enough to extinguish the Red Dragon's whole bloodline.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: No matter how the Victorians write the history books, they cannot change what facts we've seen with our own eyes.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: The Aslan promised to share Victoria's kingship with the Draco, yet didn't hand over the crown for nearly a century.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: With the lions' ambitions so conspicuous to this point, I wonder. Six blade marks stabbed King Gaeil through. How many of them were by Aslan hands?
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Not to mention the Draco king fleeing the royal capital after, fate unknown. And the Kingdom of Tara without its ruler was subjugated under Victorian sovereign authority, as if a matter of course.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: I presume it wasn't his own subjects who prevented the Draco's return to the city.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: This is why I very much enjoy your works based on the Tarans' own ballads. You've led the people to see more of history's truth.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Thank you for your appreciation.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: To write this story, I saw plays performed in the country, and paid a visit to some wandering minstrels who'd inherited the Taran tradition.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: —But what struck me most wasn't the endangerment of Taran culture. It was how so many lives were just slipping away.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: Perhaps you believe the Tarans' ideal nation, and a border with Victoria, are necessary for the Taran people to be saved.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: But I think, if we ourselves can live better, if we can plant seeds of ideas for the many Tarans who can't read...
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: Won't we have won then and there, against the Victorians who want us trapped in ignorance and poverty all our lives?
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: You want to bring that lot with you? Don't even think about it.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: If you'll wait until they rest, if you'll share your own food with them, that I can accept.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: But we've avoided the patrol out of pure luck the last two days. What if we don't the next time? Those kids must be seven or eight. Can't fight back with weapons, can't run fast enough. What do you do about that?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I can fight... I'll protect them.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You want to cross through the uninhabited region, to completely escape Trent's jurisdiction. I can aid you, the whole way.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I contacted the organization I belong to, with the help of Bagpipe and Ch'en... my colleagues. I've confirmed the closest safehouse—is just along this way.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: If all we need is some tents, and a small amount of emergency supplies for the countryside, they can transport it over without a problem.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And I know, the territory over there... belongs to a well-hearted Duke. Once we're there, the army won't be after you anymore, at the very least.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Really? There's an honest-to-God noble who'd smile on people like us?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: He has... reason to shelter the Tarans.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And how do you know?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...Before long, perhaps we'll all know.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: We'll have ways to survive, bringing those people along.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But. Don't forget. They're Infected.
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: We've constantly been scarpering with our lives. What are we doing inviting death to our sides?
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: And we don't know when the sick'll have their flare-ups. Or when they'll just kick the bucket outright...
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: What's the point in you saving these sorts of people?
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I only know, that when someone saved me... I wanted to ask her the same. Why?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Even though I was... so close to death.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: What are you getting at?
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: I'm an Infected too.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Wha? Oh. Er...
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: *cough*. Alright. Doesn't mean much to be Infected. Wouldn't have lived much longer than Infected ourselves without your help anyway. Haha.
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Still...
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Oripathy won't spread just because we're in the same place.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's okay. You can keep a bit of distance, if you're scared. I don't mind.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But take those Infected with you on your escape... Trust me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...Fine. I trust you! Selmon. You heard what she said...
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: —I'm not fleeing.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: If you're gonna take the ones that can't fight, take 'em. Suit your own self.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: But my aim isn't gonna change one bit. I'm returning to Dublinn.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...These two units have gone unaccounted for a week by now. We may surmise these circumstances relate to Dublinn, being similar to past spectre force incidents.
attributes.name: Solemn Officer

attributes.content: Similar? No, the situation we're looking at now is completely unalike.
attributes.name: Biting Officer

attributes.content: These rebels previously would muster a single armed force to surface somewhere, launch an attack, and that was it.
attributes.name: Biting Officer

attributes.content: Now, violence which we suspect to be Dublinn-incited is blanketing every corner of southern Victoria.
attributes.name: Biting Officer

attributes.content: ...Is the Marquess of Trent sticking fast to his orders?
attributes.name: Solemn Officer

attributes.content: Obviously. No matter the volume of suspicious circumstances reported outside nomadic cities, we must have CLARITY on them. Get this entire region's state of affairs under control.
attributes.name: Biting Officer

attributes.content: But of all the small-scale conflicts, only the arson at Redridge seems truly suspect, and there was no follow-up on the fire there either.
attributes.name: Solemn Officer

attributes.content: Maybe we should set these particular dossiers aside for now? Or should we leave them?
attributes.name: Solemn Officer

attributes.content: Please lend said dossiers to me, officers.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: You're... j...
attributes.name: Solemn Officer

attributes.content: And refrain with the greetings.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Also, just as before, no need to make a record of access to these dossiers.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: This arson... may be worth a deeper investigation.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Have a sip of water, ould Breandán. I picked some berries too. This place can't be too far from a settlement, what with a grove this thick.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You want some berries too, Holly? Alright, you eat those, and then you walk on your own two legs this afternoon. Won't need anyone else carrying you, okay?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: How about you, Moran? Wait, you don't eat stuff this sweet, do you...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Hey, how long are we stopping here for?
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: While Bagpipe and Ch'en are fetching things for us. We're all knackered as is, anyhow. Got a chance to catch our breaths.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Don't worry, I guarantee we'll find the closest village before lights-out.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We're far enough from all the trouble we made anyhow. If we hang around here and hole up for a few days, we oughtn't get caught.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Fine, pick me some berries too. First time seeing you happy in days.
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Er, really? I've just been glad Reed's so reliable, and her two friends too. Kind souls, plus they can fight.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You sure? It's not just how your days of suffering are almost at an end?
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: We're going to keep pushing into the wastes, find Dublinn and join them. You, though, I bet you'd prefer to stay behind in village life.
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...Er, I can't say that for sure.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I... *sigh* I just can't get over you lot doing things this way.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We were all happy just with escaping at first, the further the better. That was before we ran into Selmon.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: She only got to persuade you all to join Dublinn once stuff got tougher on us.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: None of you've... even seen a real Dublinn army, have you?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Are you still thinking about Reed?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: She contacted Rhodes Island in full view of us after borrowing our comms equipment. Getting supplies has been smooth too. All signs indicate she's not out to trick us.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Haha, I'm not suspectin' her as much, I'm just a little concerned... Did she really make a recovery?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Granted, she's a Vouivre, but I'm still a little surprised at all the life in her... She gave my hands a right shock swingin' at me before we recognized each other.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Suppose that's a good thing, though. Just, I can't shake the feelin' there's weight on her mind. Whatever it is, she wants to do it, but it seems to hurt her so much.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Plus...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Plus what?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: The way she fights just seems somehow familiar.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Did I meet her, even before Outcast brought her in, back at County Hillock?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Oh, aye, there you are, Reed! Perfect, me and Chenchen've been talkin'...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...We're talking about which way we're heading. This route happens to take us to a nearby settlement.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: No, we can't—keep going in this direction... I'll tell the others—to stop.
attributes.name: Reed
Bagpipe
attributes.content: Are you sayin'...

attributes.name: Bagpipe
attributes.content: Chenchen, on your nine!
attributes.joined: Are you sayin'...Chenchen, on your nine!

attributes.content: The cavalry saber concealed in the bushes snaps in two.
The one holding it doesn't shift an inch. Ch'en is sure her slash didn't harm anyone, but out from under the bush is still a hint of spilled blood. Blood deep and dark, old and dry.
Is this... dead patrol?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: No, they're from the barracks. There's more over there.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Traces of bolts, sabers... and Arts.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: This battle probably happened a week ago. This barracks unit was ambushed, and slaughtered to a man.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Who was the enemy, then? How come they didn't leave a single corpse behind?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: They've... left.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: They've all left? But with a battle this fierce, both sides should've taken equal damages, right?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Bagpipe, remember the group of soldiers we discovered before encountering Reed?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Mm... they had uncanny Arts planted in them, eyes full of fire...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Reed, you were in County Hillock too. Didn't you see soldiers like that?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Yes, I know of them.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: They're... parted souls.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Those with the misfortune of being deceased, yet unable to rest...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You're not sayin'—the ones who killed these soldiers are dead themselves, and they're still marchin' even after?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: The traces of firefights we were chasin' before, it resembles those too.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...It's the only possibility.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Chenchen, I don't know what your thoughts are, but I... I can't quite accept it, if that's what this is.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: What kind of person would—keep on controllin' them, even after they're dead? That's just far too cruel.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Selmon?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Like hell they're dead. You're all howling up the wrong tree.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: But we saw, with our own eyes...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You saw something somewhere else. I only believe what I see myself.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Dublinn defeated a Victorian unit. They won, moved onto the next place, and now they're prepping to save more Tarans.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: You know I'm gonna...
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...Are you worried about something?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Don't act like my da.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: If Fionn's lot want to go with you, suit their own selves, but I know you're not in with us. It's those two Vouivre you're with.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: You just want to settle us someplace, ensure we're not going to die today. You'll make us live the same old life Victoria had for us, not knowing if we'll see tomorrow.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: And after that, you'll abandon us.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Am I not right, 'Leader'?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: No. No, don't call me that...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Right. 'No.' Single word I've heard most from you so far.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I'm heading off now, going the way you didn't want us to go. It's only war and death, isn't it? Like the Tarans haven't seen plenty of both?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I don't want to hear an outsider tell me 'no' ever again.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I know she's fumin', but truth is, it's not you who's pissin' her off.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: So, are you... um, are you alright?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I want to go with her.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: There might still be... unexploded mines, and lingering Arts, left on the battlefield. It'll be dangerous to keep—going that way.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Can you call the rest over for me?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Didn't you want these Tarans to steer clear of the battlefield?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But—Selmon says, it's their choice.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And I... I promised, I'd escort them, until...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Until I'm no longer needed.
attributes.name: Reed
